job.title: Life Science Data Scientist / BioTech
job.description:
A Well-Funded BioTech start-up in the heart of Redwood city is looking for a driven Bioinformatics engineer to join the team.
As a member of the bioinformatics algorithm team, you will be empowered to develop algorithms, statistical methods, and build out our bioinformatics infrastructure
You’ll be contributing to software systems, data platforms, and externally facing applications that empower this start-ups customers to gain insight into the systemic workings of the human biome.
Required Skills & Experience
PhD (or equivalent) in relevant discipline
focus on life science tools and applications (0-8 years)
Demonstrated understanding of algorithms and statistical methods in proteomics, genomics and/or genetics
Expertise in software development (Java, C++, C#, Python and/or R) and demonstrated ability to write readable, well-documented, and unit-tested code
Strong written and oral communications skills, with demonstrated experience in cross-functional and timely communication
Strong and collaborative work ethic; must be a self-starter and persistent in achieving objectives to support Seer's scientific and business goals
Must work well in a small team setting, with ability to work independently and collaboratively, while meeting scheduled deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Highly organized, exceptional attention to detail, and strong proficiency in documentation skills
What You Will Be Doing
Support proteomics and multi-omics data discovery activities through the design and delivery of novel algorithms, statistical methods, tools and techniques
Apply novel methods to internal and external data to demonstrate impact
Work closely with the Data Engineering, Software, Machine Learning, Mass Spectrometry, Assay, Materials Technology, Marketing groups
Present results in external venues such as conferences and webinars.
Provide training and advice to scientists on optimal use of key data and analysis
Promote a culture of knowledge sharing across domains to proactively support sharing of best practices among informatics and science teams
Daily Responsibilities
80% New Development
20% Testing and Operations
The Offer
Competitive Salary: Up to $150K/year, DOE
Early Stage Start-Up Options Package
Medical and Dental Insurance
Unlimited PTO
Flexible WFH policy
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. No Sponsorship or C2C at this time
